references.paper_title: On Calibration of Modern Neural Networks
references.reason: This paper is foundational for modern confidence calibration methods, introducing Temperature Scaling and providing a baseline for evaluating calibration performance.

references.paper_title: Beyond temperature scaling: Obtaining well-calibrated multi-class probabilities with Dirichlet calibration
references.reason: This paper proposes Dirichlet Calibration, a more expressive scaling method that addresses the limitations of Temperature Scaling for multiclass classification.

references.paper_title: Obtaining calibrated probability estimates from decision trees and naive Bayesian classifiers
references.reason: This paper introduces Histogram Binning, a popular binary calibration method that is effective for problems with many classes, and also discusses One-versus-All approach.

references.paper_title: Obtaining Well Calibrated Probabilities Using Bayesian Binning
references.reason: This paper proposes Bayesian Binning into Quantiles, a Bayesian method that leverages model averaging to address the issue of overfitting in Histogram Binning, especially when data is limited.

references.paper_title: Calibrating Deep Neural Networks by Pairwise Constraints
references.reason: This paper introduces a pairwise constraint approach to confidence calibration that offers a different perspective on the calibration problem, particularly useful when dealing with complex relationships between classes.
